summary: Build a fake digital debit card app with an "Add Money" button, without mentioning that it is a simulation in the in-app UI/copy.
architectural_notes: In-app UI/copy should not mention that the debit card/balance is a simulation; avoid "simulated" or similar disclosure language in the app screens.

existing_features.title: Create a simulated (fake) digital debit card app experience that displays a digital card and a current balance, with clear in-app disclosure that it is a simulation and not a real payment product.
Implement an "Add Money" button and flow that lets the user increase the displayed balance by entering an amount, validating input, and updating the balance in the UI.
Provide a cohesive, distinctive visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across the main screen and add-money flow.
Add generated static image assets to support the visual theme, and render them from frontend static assets (do not serve images from the backend).

Remove all user-facing in-app UI copy that describes the app as a simulation, fake product, virtual balance, or otherwise discloses that it is not a real payment product. Replace the removed copy with neutral product language that does not mention simulation/fake/virtual (e.g., refer to a "digital card" and "balance" only).
Update the document title (frontend/index.html) to remove 'Fake'/'Simulated' wording and use a neutral English title consistent with the app branding.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a fake/simulated digital debit card app UI.
Add an "Add Money" button/flow to increase the displayed balance (simulated funds).
Add backend canister support to store each signed-in user's simulated balance and to apply balance increments when "Add Money" is submitted.
Remove/avoid any in-app disclosure/copy that calls the experience a simulation (no "simulated" language in the app UI).

projectName: Fake Digital Debit Card App with Simulated Add Money Balance
